data.chText: 形象；印象；声誉
data.enText: the impression that a person, an organization or a product, etc. gives to the public

data.chText: 他在公众心目中的形象与他真实的本人截然不同。
data.enText: His public image is very different from the real person.

data.chText: 这些广告旨在提高公司的形象。
data.enText: The advertisements are intended to improve the company's image.

data.chText: 在音乐界，个人形象很重要。
data.enText: Image is very important in the music world.

data.chText: 儿童图书中千篇一律的女性形象
data.enText: stereotyped images of women in children's books

data.chText: （心目中的）形象，印象
data.enText: a mental picture that you have of what sb/sth is like or looks like

data.chText: 对过去的印象
data.enText: images of the past

data.chText: 我想象出她的大致模样。
data.enText: I had a mental image of what she would look like.

data.chText: 画像；雕像；塑像
data.enText: a copy of sb/sth in the form of a picture or statue

data.chText: 洞穴壁上装饰着鹿和猎人的画像。
data.enText: Images of deer and hunters decorate the cave walls.

data.chText: 印度教神灵象头神的木雕像
data.enText: a wooden image of the Hindu god Ganesh

data.chText: 镜像；影像；映像；图像
data.enText: a picture of sb/sth seen in a mirror, through a camera, or on a television or computer

data.chText: 他凝视着自己在水中的倒影。
data.enText: He stared at his own image reflected in the water.

data.chText: 屏幕上慢慢地出现了一幅图像。
data.enText: Slowly, an image began to appear on the screen.

data.chText: 比喻；意象
data.enText: a word or phrase used with a different meaning from its normal one, in order to describe sth in a way that produces a strong picture in the mind

data.chText: 乡村的诗情画意景象
data.enText: poetic images of the countryside
be the image of sb/sth

data.chText: 酷似；和…非常相像
data.enText: to look very like sb/sth else

data.chText: 他酷似他的父亲。
data.enText: He's the image of his father.

data.text: picture ♦ drawing ♦ painting ♦ portrait ♦ illustration ♦ sketch ♦ image

data.chText: 以上各词均表示图画、绘画。
data.enText: These are all words for a scene, person or thing that has been represented on paper by drawing, painting, etc.
picture

data.chText: 指用铅笔、钢笔或颜料画出的图画、绘画：
data.enText: a scene, person or thing that has been represented on paper using a pencil, a pen or paint

data.chText: 孩子在画他们的宠物。
data.enText: The children were drawing pictures of their pets.
drawing

data.chText: 指用铅笔或钢笔而非颜料画出的图画、素描画：
data.enText: a picture that has been made using a pencil or pen, not paint

data.chText: 铅笔／木炭画
data.enText: a pencil/charcoal drawing
painting

data.chText: 指用颜料画出的图画、绘画：
data.enText: a picture that has been made using paint

data.chText: 美国艺术家的绘画作品集
data.enText: a collection of paintings by American artists
portrait

data.chText: 指肖像、半身画像、半身照：
data.enText: a painting, drawing or photograph of a person, especially of the head and shoulders

data.chText: 弗美尔的“艺术家在画室的肖像”
data.enText: Vermeer's ‘Portrait of the artist in his studio’

data.chText: 自画像
data.enText: a self-portrait (= a painting that you do of yourself)
illustration

data.chText: 指书或杂志中的插图、图表：
data.enText: a picture in a book or magazine, especially one that shows or explains sth

data.chText: 见166页上的插图。
data.enText: See illustration on p.166.
sketch

data.chText: 指素描、速写、草图：
data.enText: a simple picture that is drawn quickly and does not have many details

data.chText: 我开始作画之前通常要画几幅草图。
data.enText: I usually do a few very rough sketches before I start on a painting.
image

data.chText: 指画像、雕像、塑像：
data.enText: a copy of sb/sth in the form of a picture or statue

data.chText: 洞穴壁上装饰着鹿和猎人的画像。
data.enText: Images of deer and hunters decorate the cave walls.

data.chText: 用picture还是image？
image可指雕像、塑像；picture总是指平面图画。picture可指风景画；image总是指人或事物的画像、雕像。image较正式，较不常用。
data.enText: An image can be a statue; a picture is always two-dimensional (= flat) . A picture can show a scene; an image is always of a person or thing. Image is more formal and much less frequent.
picture or image?

ex.chText: 她凝视着自己在镜子中的映像。
ex.enText: She stared at her image in the mirror.

ex.chText: 一些图片一张接一张地逐渐出现在电脑屏幕上。
ex.enText: A few images gradually appeared on the computer screen one by one.

synonyms.bx: 指镜子、照相机镜头中的映像，也可指电视、电影或计算机屏幕上出现的图像。

ex.chText: 你知道如何改善远距离投影效果吗？
ex.enText: Do you know how to improve the long-distance projection effect?

ex.chText: 你能不能告诉我什么是正面放映？
ex.enText: Can you tell me what front projection is?

synonyms.bx: 指电影在屏幕上放映出的影像，也指幻灯片等在屏幕上投射出的影像。

d: 放映的影像；投射的影像

ex.enText: the reflection of the tree in the lake

ex.chText: 你可以在玻璃里看到你的影像。
ex.enText: You can see your reflection in the glass.

synonyms.bx: 指从镜子、水面等反射出来的影像。

ex.zh: 树立一种形象；投射一幅图像

data.enText: be the image of sb/sth

data.chText: 酷似；和…非常相像
data.enText: to look very like sb/sth else

data.chText: 他酷似他的父亲。
data.enText: He's the image of his father.

tr: a representation of a person (especially in the form of sculpture)
example: the coin bears an effigy of Lincoln
the emperor's tomb had his image carved in stone

tr: a visual representation (of an object or scene or person or abstraction) produced on a surface
example: they showed us the pictures of their wedding
a movie is a series of images projected so rapidly that the eye integrates them

tr: the general impression that something (a person or organization or product) presents to the public
example: although her popular image was contrived it served to inspire music and pageantry
the company tried to project an altruistic image

tr: (Jungian psychology) a personal facade that one presents to the world
example: a public image is as fragile as Humpty Dumpty
her imagination forced images upon her too awful to contemplate
he is the prototype of good breeding
he provided America with an image of the good father

tr: language used in a figurative or nonliteral sense
(mathematics) the set of values of the dependent variable for which a function is defined
example: the image of f(x) = x^2 is the set of all non-negative real numbers if the domain of the function is the set of all real numbers

tr: someone who closely resembles a famous person (especially an actor)
example: she's the very image of her mother
I can't see him on horseback!
I can see what will happen
I can see a risk in this strategy

tr: render visible, as by means of MRI

value.def: If you have an image of something or someone, you have a picture or idea of them in your mind.

example.ex: The image of art theft as a gentleman's crime is outdated...
example.tran: 把盗窃艺术品看作是一种绅士犯罪的观念已经过时了。

example.ex: The words 'Cote d'Azur' conjure up images of sunny days in Mediterranean cafes.
example.tran: Cote d'Azur (蓝色海岸)这个词让人联想到地中海咖啡馆阳光明媚的日子。

value.def: The image of a person, group, or organization is the way that they appear to other people.

example.ex: The Prime Minister knows that his personal image is his greatest political asset...
example.tran: 总理知道他的个人形象是他最重要的政治资产。

example.ex: He has cultivated the image of an elder statesman...
example.tran: 他已树立起一个政界元老的形象。

example.ex: The tobacco industry has been trying to improve its image.
example.tran: 烟草行业一直在试图改善其形象。

value.tran: (个人、团队或组织的)形象,声誉

value.def: An image is a picture of someone or something.

example.ex: A computer in the machine creates an image on the screen.
example.tran: 机器上的计算机在屏幕上产生了影像。

value.def: An image is a poetic description of something.

example.ex: The natural images in the poem are meant to be suggestive of realities beyond themselves.
example.tran: 诗中描绘的自然景象意在让人联想到景象以外的现实。

value.tran: 诗意的描绘;生动的描绘

value.def: If you are the image of someone else, you look very much like them.

example.ex: Marianne's son was the image of his father.
example.tran: 玛丽安娜的儿子长得酷似他父亲。

partsOfSpeech.dec: imag 想象 + ine 表抽象名词 → 想象
imagin〔e〕想象 + able 可…的 → 可想象的
imagin〔e〕想象 + ative 有…倾向（性质）的，属于…的 → 富于想象的
